text: section of metal grating fell from small height causing minor head injury. during the entry into an enclosure, wood employee was positioned around 30cm below the grating floor, while some sections of that grating were removed to gain the access to the enclosure. during the task, one of clients operations supervisors came to the area with the inspection, he stood on one of the grating panels causing it to dislodge and fall below. grating weighing approx. 10kg came into contact with ips hard hat, causing it to fall. part of the grating panel made contact with ips head causing a minor scratch. the ip was evacuated to the cmt gbrs where he received first aid without medical treatment. ip returned to his work station following an examination.an investigation has been launched with wood representative on site to find out incident causes.

the ip bumped their forehead on a glass door.  on friday, february 26, 2016, the ip was walking out of a conference room on the 4th floor while talking to someone instead of looking ahead. the ip ended up walking into a glass door which caused him to bump his forehead. the ip didn't receive any treatment. this incident was not reported to the hsse department until 5 days later. no immediate action was taken as this incident was not reported to the hsse department until 5 days later.

category: back injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, excavations
text: power line stretched during excavation for storm drain excavator operator pulled concrete obstruction identified within a small trench excavation (intended for stormwater infrastructure installation).  the concrete obstruction appeared to be waste concrete materials from historic maintenance work at the facility.  in the process of pulling the concrete obstruction, a conduit containing 480v power conductors for the lime silo was stretched, resulting in a gfi trip to the lime silo junction box and subsequently resulting in power loss to the central treatment plant. previous locates did not identify this conductor.  the line was not marked, was buried at a depth of approximately 2 feet and contained no warning tape. the line was buried adjacent to the concrete obstruction. during the excavation process, the operator encountered a piece of concrete.  after ascertaining that the concrete did not contain duct banks, etc, he proceeded to remove the concrete obstruction.  teeth of the excavator struck the electrical conduit.  although the conductor itself was not contacted by the excavator teeth, the insulation was nicked and the conductors were pulled tight at the lime silo breaker.  the lime silo breaker tripped creating a ground faultwhich in turn tripped the main mcc breaker. electrician arrived on site at 1615 hours and repaired the damage by reinsulating the nicked electical wires and pulling slack back into the lime silo disconnect.  full power was restored at 1800 hours.there were no injuries as a result of this incident.a full safety stop was issued for all excavation operations at the site until the sr hse manager was able to investigate and close the incident.
non work related covid case  wood contractor was taken of the rig after testing positive for covid. person removed from rig and now self isolating at home

skid steer operator closed equipment window that then shattered resulting in an abrasion to the left index finger.			 at approximately 10:45 am, on april 28th, 2021, a skid steer operator was tasked to mow grass in block 1. the operator was performing an equipment inspection prior to initiating the task and closed the window on the right side of the john deer 331g skid steer. the operator used both gloved hands to shut the window when the force applied resulted in the glass shattering, causing an abrasion (less than 1/8”) to the ip’s left index finger. the actual and potential rating were chosen as a b1 due to the injury to the team member resulted in first aid treatment and the cost of the window replacement will be less than $5k.			 scene was frozen in a safe condition. ip was escorted to the safety office where first aid treatment (cleaning and bandaging of the wound) was provided. the operator performed a post incident ua and was released to work with no restrictions. investigation protocols were initiated. skid steer was put out of service until repairs can be made. vendor notified of damage to skid steer and a repair notice will be generated.

wood employee was unloading chemical containers from a trailer with a skid steer with forks when a container fell off the trailer on 03/10/2020 at the eog wayzetta yard, a wood employee was unloading chemical containers from the back of a trailer with a skid steer with a fork attachment. employee inserted the forks into the container pallet, then lifted the container and tilted it towards the skid steer to remove it from the trailer. as employee did this, the bottom of the container he was lifting contacted the container sitting on the trailer directly behind the one he was unloading, causing the sitting container to fall off the trailer to ground level. the potential rating is based on the fact that there was no one around the operation when the container fell and there were only a few people total onsite. no spill or leak from the container occurred as a result of the event. work was immediately stopped to check for spills or damage to the container. container was brought into the facility and further inspected for damage.

a wood employee took a pcr test following a covid infection of his brother; he received a positive result. on sunday morning 27th june 2021, a wood employee reported that his brother who is living with them in the same house tested positive for covid. the employee has not come to office since thursday 24th june, he took a covid test on sunday 27th june and received a positive result on monday 28th june. the employee was asked to self-isolate, contact tracing was completed and the office was disinfected.

employee walking through mill, noticed newly installed tray 346 had damaged rungs in a section. worker was walking through mill 1 column g5 area, worker identified newly installed tray 346 had damaged rungs in a section. contacted supervisor, scene secured, investigation initiated.

prolonged polluted runoff from access road network into euchan water due to heavy traffic on the existing forestry road network during a period of severe weather conditions (snow/ice), following the thaw the road integrity degraded to such an extent that a layer of sludge formed on the road surface. existing installed mitigations were unable to cope with this increased loading which led to an undetermined amount of silt laden water flowing into the euchan water. incident reported to sepa. all works stopped on site. mitigation plans prepared and submitted to sepa. mitigation works started as soon as the mitigation plans were approved by sepa.

confirmed positive for covid-19 employee received positive covid-19 test results. employee was in a training on december 21 and 22 with two other colleagues.  employee received positive test results on december 23rd.  additional contact tracing underway.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: while tacking guides onto a beam, worker pulled at rod, causing guide to fall approx 25 feet to ground below worker was tacking guides onto a beam on the third level of the evaporator.  in the process of tacking the guide, the welding rod got stuck.  when the worker attempted to pull the rod off the guide, the guide separated from the beam, falling approximately 30 feet to the ground below. investigation begun

superficial scratch of middle left finger. on 26/01/2016, around 11:20 the rigger was manipulating 20"flanged pipe. the pipe has slid towards the closer one pinching the rigger's left middle finger causing a small scratch.  the rigger has been accompanied to the tra total medical center where he received medical care,  then he came back to the daily activity.

category: covid, general illness or health issue
text: employee was on his days off and prior to reporting to work began to feel ill and tested positive for covid-19. a wood employee was on a 21 day off work rotation and began feeling ill around day 20.  the employee followed protocol for notifying their manager of illness prior to reporting to work. the employee proceeded to personal physician for evaluation and was tested positive for covid-19.   employee will be quarantined at home for 14 days pending symptoms remain mild to moderate. the client was notified of the employee absence and test results. employee will receive another covid-19 test prior to being cleared to return to work.

employee has misjudged the step when coming down the stairs resulting in a rolled ankle.  whilst exiting the phase 1 office on the eastern side, employee has misjudged the step when coming down the stairs resulting in a rolled ankle.  employee assisted to medical centre for review and treatment and returned to normal duties. investigation commenced.
2 x employees tested positive for covid 2 x employees tested positive for covid reported to line management

sewage system backed up at clute commerce complex. environmental was contacted and surveyed the area then contacted a local plumbing company to fix the issue. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36314a security guard noticed sewage water coming from a clean out cover during his rounds and contacted hsse in the fab shop. the environmental manager arrived on site after being contacted by regional hsse manager and checked facilities for back flow into buildings, none was discovered. local plumbing company was contacted to determine the cause of the backflow and fix back up. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

team were removing a spool piece that twisted and fell to grade  team were removing a spool piece from a gas line (isolated) the spool was supported by strops from a tele handler, it seems on the last two bolts the spool twisted and spun, resulting in part of the pipe striking the ground  task was made safe , until a lift plan/plan of action could be devised by site team to lift the spool out safely witness statement taken from individuals involved

.33 lb electrical cable splicing tool fell 20' into red barricaded area without injury. dropped object category (minor) an electrician helper was pulling cable in pr 1 when a pair of cable splicing tools with a combined weight of .33 lbs came out of his leather holder and fell 20’ to grade. the leather holder was secured to the electrician’s belt. the area below was red barricaded and there were no injuries as result of this event. incident was reported, and investigation initiated. a safety stand-down was conducted with merit electrical by wood electrical superintendent to discuss incident and corrective/preventative actions.

employee stung by bee employee was working in the off plot area and was stung by a bee on right lower leg. he reported the sting to his immediate supervisor. he was brought to the bay safety office and then taken to occucare for treatment. he was seen by occucare and released for duty afterwards.

ee felt discomfort to right forearm and wrist while pushing a roll of scrap cable onto the back of a trailer.  employee was tasked with putting scrap cable onto a trailer with a partner. scrap cable was rolled up into coils. employee had been doing this approximately 3 hours before the incident. employee and partner stood a coil up and rolled it toward the back of a trailer. employee the pushed it onto the back of the trailer, causing discomfort to the employee's right forearm and wrist.  cold therapy and ibuprofen

home working ip tested +ve for covid-19 home working ip tested +ve for covid-19 on a lateral flow test and began to develop symptoms. ip decided not to have a pcr test as he 'knew' it was covid. his family are also positive. line manager keeping in touch with ip

ip tested positive. no other details. all contacts have been sent for testing. ip tested positive. no other details. all contacts have been sent for testing. ip isolated. all contacts have been sent for testing.

a 3rd wood employee was embarked  on mv-18. the ip performed the covid-19 test with a positive result.  a 3rd wood employee was embarked  on mv-18. the ip performed the covid-19 test with a positive result. the ip is symptomatic  the worker is feeling symptoms such as loss of taste and smell. the ip received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be sent home for quarantine period.

category: dropped object or material, weather related issue
text: due to the winds gusting up to 50 mph, the cabin door closed with force on foot, due to the winds gusting up to 50 mph, the cabin door closed with force on foot, fortunatley wearing rigger style boots and foot came out of boot before door shut. this could have resulted in an injury if i had been wearing lace up boots. opened the door with 2 hands, then when wind dropped, retreived boot and closed door.

rh bodyside inner part was loaded into the gripper and clamped up. in the process of moving round to its next position the part fell out of the gripper and hit the floor. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38342what.rh bodyside inner part was loaded into the gripper and clamped up. in the process of moving round to its next position the part fell out of the gripper and hit the floor.where.z22.1 plc 2 tabbing 1 stn 80/90when.during commissioning.why.either the robot logic stepped on because the relevant conditions were met or due to manual intervention the clamp open output was still high. the gripper clamps opened and the part fell to the floor. this area is still being commissioned, so some errors are to be expected as manual intervention is in place. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

while welding a flangeolet onto the maintenance flare system, the work party heard a burst of air under pressure coming from the pilot hole, felt heat from the air and personal monitor was activated. no injuries or asset damage. migrated from legacy cairs incident #39850on tuesday 2nd october 2018 work was underway to install a branch fitting for a flow transmitter on an 8" line flowing from the maintenance flare knockout drum to the maintenance flare. this was a scope of work outlined by shell, designed by wood psdp from the galway office, and controlled by wood pscs at bbgt. all perimetry and associated method statement risk assessments were developed by the wood site team. shell implemented isolations associated with the task and approved the permit to work submitted by wood. the work involved drilling a 34mm diameter hole into the 8” line and then welding a fitting (flangeolet) on top of this hole to facilitate the installation of the flow transmitter. after the 34mm hole had been drilled into the line and the initial tacking of the fitting was completed, final welding of the fitting commenced. after about 2 minutes into the welding operation a sudden single burst of pressurised warm air came out through the 34mm hole which was heard and heat haze was seen by the work party. work was stopped immediately, and the work party left the habitat and reported the incident to the control room. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: ip stepped down onto the trailer hitch and his foot slipped. ip fell onto ground landing on left elbow.  camp trailers arrived to site dirty from travel on highways. trailers were brought to sultan road laydown area and workers began cleaning the trailers with pressure washers. a cold winter weather event occurred on day of incident. the ip noticed that the pressure washer was freezing up and decided to shut it down for the day. the ip climbed into the back of flat deck of truck and shut down the pressure washer. when the ip climbed down off the truck bed he stepped on the trailer hitch and his foot slipped. the ip fell to the ground landing on his left elbow. the ip notified his supervisor and was escorted to the site medic. site medic performed assesment. ip was treated with rest, ice and over the counter medication for any pain. worker returned to regular duties with no restriction.  supervisor notified and ip sent to site medic for assesment.

category: vehicle Incident involving animal, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: while driving to work in personal car, side door was struck by a kangaroo. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38087while driving personal car to work a kangaroo jumped into rear drivers side door causing minor damage. no injuries. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

a wood employee informed his line manager that he was experiencing discomfort and irritation in his eye. at approx 1400 hours, a wood employee informed his line manager that he was experiencing discomfort and irritation in his eye due to unknown cause whilst sitting at his desk .  the ip was taken to hospital for checking. after checking the ip's eye, the doctor said he can't see a problem with the eye but the issue could be due to some allergy. the ip was given eye drops was was asked to revisit the doctor in a week time. the ip resumed his work without been absent.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was standing on a forklift with a spool of pipe and its supporting cribbage. the employee was trying to reposition the pipe spool when the forklift moved, causing the spool to smash the employee's left finger on the supporting cribbage. the employee's left fingertip was amputated.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment two employees were trying to lift a container from an aircraft. one employee's hand was caught between the aircraft and the container, causing the amputation of the employee's middle, ring, and little fingers.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was stepping down from a three-step top stock cart and missed the last step, falling to the floor. she was hospitalized with a fractured left hip.

struck by object or equipment dropped by injured worker an employee was positioning an ingredient barrel on a pallet when he lost hold of the drum. his finger was pinched between the drum and a diagonal i-beam. his index fingertip was amputated.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee was attempting to free an apple that was stuck in an auger when the employee's clothing became caught in the auger. the employee then suffered a left hand amputation at the wrist, broken bones, contusions, and lacerations.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee was changing a font print blanket on a printer when their left middle finger was caught between the blanket drum and the plate drum support resulting in amputation.

overexertion in lifting-single episode on november 15, 2020, an employee attempted to lift a patient that had fallen to the floor. the employee experienced abdominal pain and was hospitalized for a hernia that required surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was feeding paper from a roll into a paper machine. a piece of paper was caught in the machine; the employee was removing it when his left middle finger was caught between a pulley and the paper roll. the fingertip (including tissue and bone) was amputated.

exposure to environmental heat an employee was feeling dehydrated and experiencing cramping after coming down from pressure washing the interior of a water tank. the employee was hospitalized for symptoms related to heat exhaustion.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was cutting lumber on a table saw. the sawblade amputated part of the employee's left index finger.

struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was removing a tree when it hit the employee and caused injury requiring hospitalization.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was using a tool to clear a jam in the rotary cutter machine when the door on the machine closed on his left thumb resulting in a loss of flesh on the front of the thumb without bone loss.

category: head or face injury, dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was removing passenger bags from a conveyor belt while a string of four dollies was carrying empty ld3 containers from a flight. the last dolly clipped a curb and an ld3 bounced off the dolly and struck the employee. the employee suffered a fractured left tibia and a head contusion.

caught between rolling powered vehicle and other object an employee was standing on an out feed table stacking boards when the fork carriage moved forward, catching his left leg between the fork carriage and a roll case. his left leg suffered a laceration/fracture. the out feed table was not locked/tagged out at the time.

entangled in other object or equipment an employee was holding a piece of looped carbon fiber thread when his left index finger became tangled in the loop as it was entering a pre-carbonizer. as he removed his finger from the loop, his left index finger was amputated.

category: back injury, general injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified on or about july 28, 2016, at 7:00 a.m., an employee was on the second landing of a scaffold on the side of a building, preparing a chalk line to put a v-groove in a column. when he stood up, he became dizzy and fainted. he fell forward toward the building and onto a brick ledge, fracturing several vertebrae, his left scapula, and several left- and right-side ribs. he was hospitalized.

category: dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was helping to prepare an electrical transformer for shipment to a customer's location. the transformer was moved to a pallet. when a forklift approached the pallet to pick it up, the transformer began to lean and then fall toward the ground. the employee, in an attempt to stop the 1,200-pound transformer from falling, reached out his left arm, which was then crushed between the transformer and the work table. he fractured his left forearm (ulnar and radius) and all five digits on his left hand.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment employee sustained an amputation of the right pinky fingertip while loading a wooden reel onto a pack line. his right little finger was crushed between the flange and the reel.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was installing a ramp weighing approximately 500 pounds from the sidewalk to the back of a trailer when his left ring finger became pinched between the ramp and the sidewalk, resulting in amputation.

category: lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: struck against stationary object or equipment, n.e.c. a temporary employee was conducting electrical work at a jobsite. the employee was pushing down a pipe with their left hand and their right hand was applying force on top of the left hand. the employee's left hand slipped and was cut by a piece of metal bracing next to the pipe. the laceration required surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee entered the festooner machine to fix material that was not laying correctly. the employee was pinned between the slow moving part and the body of the machine resulting in a small laceration to the liver. the machine was not locked out/tagged out at the time.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was helping to move jersey barriers from a corner to clean up for a storm water inspection. a coworker was lifting the barrier with a skid steer that had forklift forks installed. one corner of the barrier was elevated on the forks approximately 10 inches high when the employee went over the barrier to move a tool that was in the way of where they were moving the barrier. when he was on the other side of the barrier, the concrete corner that was elevated broke off of the barrier. the barrier then fell sideways onto the employee, pinning him between the fallen barrier and the street curb and breaking his left leg.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was exiting the office building and descending the entry staircase when she missed the bottom step and fell onto the sidewalk, breaking her left distal femur and requiring hospitalization.
